question_sentence: What is the nickname of David Markland, the owner of Combat Zone Wrestling?
What is one of the key healthcare reforms advocates are pushing for in Delaware?
What species is Big Stone Beach designated as a sanctuary for?
What new technology has been made available to all prisoners in Delaware?
How much is the first mansion in Westover Hills, Greenville, priced at?
Where did the Afghan women flee from to attend the University of Delaware?
What event did A.I. du Pont High School alumni honor their late band director Paul Parets at?
What is the nickname for the century-old creamy beef breakfast dish?
What was the main issue Phish fans faced during the Mondegreen festival?
What happened to Delabear on Route 1 near New Castle?
choices: It was killed by a motorist

question_sentence: Republican Donald Trump won the popular vote over Democrat Kamala Harris by what margin in the US presidential election?
evidence: Trump received about 49.8% of the popular vote to 48.3% for Harris.

question_sentence: Which city hosted the Summer Olympics?
evidence: Thousands of the world’s top athletes put on a spectacular show in the French capital. The 2028 Summer Olympics will be in Los Angeles.

question_sentence: Syrian President Bashar al-Assad was ousted from power in a swift and stunning rebellion. Which country granted him asylum?
evidence: Assad received asylum in Russia, a longtime supporter of the Syrian dictator.

question_sentence: A cargo ship crashed into the Francis Scott Key Bridge in which city, causing it to collapse?
evidence: The huge ship rammed a support pillar of the Baltimore bridge, which fell into the Patapsco River.

question_sentence: UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson was gunned down outside a New York City hotel. Where was the suspect captured?
evidence: Luigi Mangione was arrested at a McDonald’s restaurant in Pennsylvania and faces a murder charge.

question_sentence: Which tennis legend known as the “King of Clay” retired after winning 22 grand slam singles titles during his career?
evidence: Nadal earned the nickname for his unprecedented success playing on that surface. He won the French Open a record 14 times.

question_sentence: Which country elected its first female president this year?
evidence: Claudia Sheinbaum won in a landslide to become the first female president of Mexico.

question_sentence: Shortly after the November election, President Joe Biden pardoned his son Hunter Biden, who faced sentencing on which charges?
evidence: The president pardoned his son for federal tax and gun convictions.

question_sentence: A total solar eclipse in April created stunning views in North America. When is the next total solar eclipse with a coast-to-coast path across the US?
evidence: The next total solar eclipse with a coast-to-coast path spanning the Lower 48 states will occur on August 12, 2045.

question_sentence: Which Russian opposition leader died in a penal colony under mysterious circumstances?
evidence: Navalny was an outspoken critic of Russian President Vladimir Putin, and his death sparked international outrage.

question_sentence: Eric Adams was indicted on public corruption charges. He serves as mayor of which city?
evidence: New York’s mayor faces five federal charges, including bribery and wire fraud.

question_sentence: Which hurricane made landfall in Florida and wreaked havoc across the Southeast, including deadly flooding in North Carolina?
evidence: Hurricane Helene came ashore on Florida’s Gulf Coast in September and caused catastrophic flooding in North Carolina.

question_sentence: Which movie won Best Picture at the 96th Academy Awards?
evidence: “Oppenheimer” took home seven Oscars, including Best Picture.

question_sentence: There were two assassination attempts on Donald Trump’s life. Where did they take place?
evidence: Shots were fired at Trump during a Pennsylvania campaign rally, and the Secret Service targeted a man with a rifle outside a Florida golf club.

question_sentence: Which NFL team won the Super Bowl for the second year in a row?
evidence: The Chiefs beat the 49ers in overtime to become the first back-to-back Super Bowl champions in 19 years.

question_sentence: Nearly everyone living in Gaza has been displaced by Israel’s war against Hamas. What is the population of Gaza?
evidence: The United Nations estimates the population of Gaza to be around 2.1 million people.

question_sentence: Joe Biden dropped out of the presidential race after what happened?
choices: He lost a delegate vote at the Democratic convention.
The Supreme Court removed him from the ballot.
He performed poorly at a debate.
evidence: Biden decided not to seek reelection after a disastrous debate performance against Donald Trump.

question_sentence: Which state’s top court ruled that frozen embryos are children and those who destroy them can be held liable for wrongful death?
evidence: The Alabama Supreme Court ruling cast doubt on the future of those embryos and in-vitro fertilization, while putting reproductive rights in the spotlight.

question_sentence: Which troubled test flight left two astronauts in space far longer than planned?
evidence: The Boeing Starliner capsule returned home without astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams, who will remain at the International Space Station until 2025.

question_sentence: Taylor Swift’s Eras Tour is the highest-grossing concert tour in history. Which solo artist held the previous record?
evidence: Elton John’s Farewell Yellow Brick Road Tour grossed more than $900 million.
